name: @thej@social.thej.in
note: Hacker, Maker, Blogger, Developer, Teacher, Public Interest Technologist @DataMeet & CTO @Peppo. I blog at ThejeshGN.com and this is my social microblog. Everything is Personal. Bangalore/India. +05:30, IST. He/His. Email.

content.html: Tell me about your side project!
content.value: Tell me about your side project!

content.html:
Over the past twenty years I have worked on several projects to support people who teach about plants. My biggest project, which I started in 2009, is ‚ÄúTeaching Tools in Plant Biology‚Äù. These are a series of peer-reviewed articles, with slides ,developed to support the undergraduate teaching and learning. You can find the entire series here. Free to download and use for educational purposes! https://academic.oup.com/plcell/pages/teaching-tools-plant-biology
#PlantScience #PlantSci

content.html:
I really truly think a social media hack is enthusiasm.

People (maybe a majority) follow me on Twitter who have no career focus on computer security.
I follow farmers on YouTube just talking about their tractor repair tribulations with perseverance. I will absolutely never drive a tractor or put any direct tractor knowledge they give me into practice. But I care because they communicate larger fundamental insights into finding solutions.

This is a magic ingredient. You can't really fake it. And people know when they see it. It's one of those inescapably human manifestations the brain recognizes micro-signals from.
content.value: I really truly think a social media hack is enthusiasm.People (maybe a majority) follow me on Twitter who have no career focus on computer security.I follow farmers on YouTube just talking about their tractor repair tribulations with perseverance. I will absolutely never drive a tractor or put any direct tractor knowledge they give me into practice. But I care because they communicate larger fundamental insights into finding solutions.This is a magic ingredient. You can't really fake it. And people know when they see it. It's one of those inescapably human manifestations the brain recognizes micro-signals from.

content.html:
"Of 20 government datasets that¬†IndiaSpend¬†analysed, the collection of data or its public release has been delayed for 12 datasets. Crucial data such as from the census, household expenditure and poverty estimates, which influence other data sets and policymaking, are over two years old.
Political manipulation in data releases and a weakened data infrastructure are primary reasons for these delays, experts say."

https://www.indiaspend.com/data-gaps/indias-population-poverty-and-consumption-data-missing-as-2022-comes-to-a-close-847806

content.html:
Hello fellow citizens of the free and open web, it is me, Ben Brown. You may remember me from that social network from back when social networks were cool, or maybe from that one open source project that blew up.

Hi, it is great to see you again.

First off, corporate owned social media always sucked, we always knew it. It is past time for us to have better options.I am so glad for the #Fediverse and #ActivityPub and Mastodon and other projects for breathing new life into the indie web, where it is possible for us to own what we post and use whatever tools we want. I couldn‚Äôt resist building something!

My new project is called SHUTTLECRAFT. It social media server ‚Ä¶ FOR ONE.

What does that mean?

It is very small and lightweight open source app that runs nicely on services like Glitch, but it has most of what you need to host your own personal social media account.

It‚Äôs got a microblogging tool, to make posts. You can customize the design with HTML and CSS. You can follow people on Mastodon or other services and interact with posts and send messages. People can follow you on Mastodon, or with RSS. You run it on your own server so you own and operate the data and the code and the whole service. And you can hack the code and make it weirder so that we can all be part of a better, more diverse and more interesting web.

No billionaires or mega-corps required!

I made a 3 minute video showing how it works:
https://www.loom.com/share/a6441bcebdc64f54b5010c95eae1e180

Though this a personal project and only a few weeks old, with tons of stuff still unfinished and yet to build... you can get the code right now and run your own right now! The official site also has a 3 minute walk through of setting up an instance on Glitch. It is pretty easy!

https://shuttlecraft.net/

Or go straight to for the code:

https://github.com/benbrown/shuttlecraft

Thanks to everyone who has already tested this or sent feedback or contributed code. Y'all rule.

Own your posts!! Make it hard for them to monetize you!

content.html:
I've been experimenting with the ESP32 recently. I wanted to see how well you could track its location using open WiFi networks and DNS requests. Please take a look at my write-up if interested.

https://jamesdotcom.com/location-tracking-with-wifi/

content.html:
Blog: The Year that was 2022

I must say 2022 was a better year than 2020 or 2021, both personally and professionally. Many things which we started earlier; started showing results this year. Hopefully, the world has begun recovering from COVID as well.

A very happy new year to you all. I wish you the very best.

https://thejeshgn.com/2022/12/31/the-year-that-was-2022/

content.html:
Blog: Weekly Notes 52/2022

We were supposed to be in Bangalore tomorrow, just in time for the new year. But Anju‚Äôs grandmother passed away this morning. She was 90+ years. She had a wonderful life filled with grand-kids, great grand-kids. Death was peaceful. Her image in my head is always of the person reading the newspaper in the morning.

https://thejeshgn.com/2022/12/30/weekly-notes-52-2022/

content.html:
Catching up to an #introduction:

I'm admin here on spaceup.city. By day I lead #software teams at Blue Origin in #Seattle, holding #space where I can.

I'm an amateur at #photography but hope to snap more #cities and share what makes a city livable, like #carfree streets and #PublicTransit and #trains. Until then I post pictures of #cats.

I'm a #geek about #StarTrek #reading #books #SciFi #BoardGames #physics #tea and #TimeTravel, so don't expect a consistent theme.

By day I lead #software teams at Blue Origin in #Seattle, holding #space where I can.I'm an amateur at #photography but hope to snap more #cities and share what makes a city livable, like #carfree streets and #PublicTransit and #trains. content.html:
Twitter is dying like all of the Java monoliths and Kube clusters. It‚Äôs taking a while, but rest assured they are dying. Each day another important maintenance task is neglected. Some YAML is merged with limited review. Some service is prematurely opened up for convenience. There will be no investment in anything that doesn‚Äôt immediately put money back into the company.

Think about what this means for users.
content.value: Twitter is dying like all of the Java monoliths and Kube clusters. It‚Äôs taking a while, but rest assured they are dying. Each day another important maintenance task is neglected. Some YAML is merged with limited review. Some service is prematurely opened up for convenience. There will be no investment in anything that doesn‚Äôt immediately put money back into the company.Think about what this means for users.

content.html:
What white folks don't understand is we still have grandparents who are alive and can tell us the truth.
My Grandpa was born and raised in Mississippi and his stories fill in the gaps for real .
Real stories of oppression he and his parents had to put up with in his own country ffs!
That is what drives me , what gives me the energy to fight back and show what we can achieve.
Segregation is recent history. We can't just forget and forgive!

#BlackMastodon #BlackLivesMatter #BlackFedi

And ‚Ä¶ Roam with Mastodon is now available for Firefox!

https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/roam-with-mastodon/

- Follow and boost people on other Mastodon servers with one click

- Share interesting links and sites

- Schedule posts for later

(Chrome/Arc extension is here https://fo.llow.social/roam/add-to-chrome)

#Mastodon #Firefox #Chrome
